I did a pass. I am not sure this needs fixing. Passing `null` to a method that is meant to deserialize what's passed to it is OK to throw an exception. Ideally one which indicates exactly what went wrong. What's the rationale for adding support for passing `null`?
This looks good. I'll merge it.
I also did a pass.

> I tested the operations in a similar fashion as Broadcast/Reduce in the BroadcastREEF example, although I didn't include it in this PR.

Any reason not to include the tests? The more tests, the better :-)

This pull request looks good
Thanks @markusweimer for the second pass. I'll test and merge.
I did a pass (see above). Beyond that, I'd still prefer the nested `switch` statements to make things easier to parse.

In this revision, I used this line:
!isDoneOrFailedOrKilled(from) && isDoneOrFailedOrKilled(to)
to avoid the verbosity of using nested switches, since it seems that any non-terminal state can transition to a terminal state, and a terminal state cannot transition to a different terminal state; other than that, there only seems to be one legal type of state transition for each non-terminal state. Perhaps nested switch statements can provide more flexibility and make the code more clear. I will push another commit. Thanks!
This is ready for another look. Thanks!
Thanks, this looks good, and is much easier to verify :-) I'll test and merge.

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #568](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/568/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good
I'll test and merge.
I'll do another pass.

This has me confused :-)

I thought the issue was that we needed to avoid Java trying to deserialize the Service Configuration, as that fails. In the fullness of time, this will work and I don't want to contaminate the public API with workarounds, which this change seems to do: It changes the group communications API and introduces a new concept of first creating a Service Configuration with its API and then passing that over to `SubmitContextAndService`.

I'd much prefer a solution that is purely on the side of the REEF implementation, maintaining current APIs. Couldn't we just change the implementation of `SubmitContextAndService` to do the following?
1. Take the `IConfiguration` passed and serialize it.
2. Bind the serialized form to a `string` in a new `IConfiguration`. 
3. Pass that new `IConfiguration` on to the Java side.

Then, on the Evaluator, we'd have to add code to unwrap the service configuration for use. Both of these code paths should be marked as hotfixes such that we can find them again in the future, e.g. while working on the new Evaluator.

This is the API that Dhruv needed. He added this API and passed ICodec configuration to it and it triggers the bug. Without this client passed configuration, we were fine. 

Yes, we can put entire service configuration as a string. Not sure it might need Java side changes. If we would like to change the protoco between Java and Evaluator, we might want to do it separately.

I've done my pass.

Either leave WrapServiceConfigAsString inside ServiceConfiguration class, put relevant code together, or move it to the class where it is used as a private method, so that it is hidden to the public, both should work. I now changed it to latter.
I'll merge this.

I've done a syntax path. I feel this could be split into (at least) two pull requests:
1. Add `IStreamingCodec`, implementations for (arrays of) base types and tests.
2. Use it in group communications.

That way, each of those separate changes gets the attention it needs.
